OASS-A is a homodimer of 315 amino acid residues per subunit and the two active sites are located on opposite side, far from the dimer interface. Each subunit is made of two domains, a C-terminal and an N-terminal domain. In turn, each domain is composed of an α/β-fold with a central twisted β-sheet surrounded by α-helixes
8 . Concerning the folding, A and B isozymes follow a similar pattern, but in terms of active site the B isoform presents two additional acidic residues, which increase its overall charge
7 .
